message.content:
Step 1. Calculate the Debt to Asset Ratio.
• From the balance sheet, Total Liabilities is given as "Total Current Liabilities": 3,143,833.89.
• Total Assets at period end are 33,082,821.36.
• Debt to Asset Ratio = Total Liabilities / Total Assets = 3,143,833.89 / 33,082,821.36 ≈ 0.0951.
• Rounded to two decimals, we get 0.10.

Step 2. Calculate the Gross Profit Margin.
• From the income statement, Gross Profit = 6,476,677.56 and Total Revenue = 22,876,677.56.
• Gross Profit Margin = (Gross Profit / Total Revenue) × 100% = (6,476,677.56 / 22,876,677.56) × 100% ≈ 28.33%.

Step 3. Calculate the Operating Cash Flow Ratio.
• From the cash flow statement, Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –16,772,398.72.
• Using the same Total Current Liabilities of 3,143,833.89 (from the balance sheet) :
• Operating Cash Flow Ratio = Net Operating CF / Total Current Liabilities = –16,772,398.72 / 3,143,833.89 ≈ –5.337.
• Rounded to two decimals, the ratio is approximately –5.34.

Finally, the answer is provided in the required json format.

{
  "solution": {
    "Debt to Asset Ratio": "0.10",
    "Gross Profit Margin": "28.33%",
    "Operating Cash Flow Ratio": "-5.34"
  }
}
